page.title: 04BOXGROVE PRIORY
page.content: {PRIORY CHURCH OF ST.MARY & ST.BLAISE In 1108 Robert de la Haye married the sister of his overlord the Earl of Arundel. They marked this occasion by a gift of property in England to their "home" Abbey at Lessay, in the Cotentin peninsula, 35 miles south of Cherbourg in Normandy. The Abbot sent three of his Monks to Boxgrove to Superintend their new property. The community became a "cell" of the mother house and in 1115 a Priory and Church was begun. The number of monks was gradually increased by benefactions from 3 to a total of 19 in the year 1230. Architecturally, the Church shows evidence of three main building campaigns. (1) c.1120 Norman style (2) c.1170 Transitional style and (3)circa 1220 Early English Style.
